doc.previous: Britannica Junior was first published in 1934 as 12 volumes It was expanded to 15 volumes in 1947 and renamed Britannica Junior Encyclop dia in 1963 17 It was taken off the market after the 1984 printing
doc.after: A British Children s Britannica edited by John Armitage was issued in London in 1960 18 Its contents were determined largely by the 11 plus standardised tests given in Britain 19 Britannica introduced the Children s Britannica to the U S market in 1988 aimed at ages 7 to 14
